topics.title: Technical question about broken links.
topics.body:
I put many of the files for my personal website in a folder "15VVHT6AhAZDSJinHKZMf9VTc1uCGG1HvZ"   long link is http://127.0.0.1:43110/15VVHT6AhAZDSJinHKZMf9VTc1uCGG1HvZ  :

The index.html appears to load, but a link on the page that leads to the "Bookbag"  subdirectory in "15VVHT6AhAZDSJinHKZMf9VTc1uCGG1HvZ" breaks and gives me "Not Found: /Bookbag"  

Is there a simple fix?

id/unknown

3@20.body:
nofish when I clicked on your link, I got "Media referer error"
Exactly how it was spelled too.

"I think he meant to link http://127.0.0.1:43110/1BLuish1ZbwVfPaCSDVQkg5WW58hqEoYQw/index.html"

Yes, that one worked.

I just noticed the "/media/" in the original link posted.

2@82.body:
Thanks for the link.

Now my next project is going to see if I can get my d/mrzigler.bit to connect.

1@77.body:
Hello 1CP7VD25Z3W2nYzJ4CUcnTQt7YpMQW8dhT! /u/WarsawsBlinkingLight

Did you sign and publish?

"Strange, I have other people that are confirming that it works."

The delay may be my local system
Video works, but I see no picture.
